result.execSummary:
The defendant David A Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence with credit for 10 days time served. Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and treatment.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay the DNA fee out of bail on deposit, if any; with the balance due prior to the end of the probationary period. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept. Court waives all other costs and surcharges. Defendant indigent.
*Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.

*No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
*No contact with Best Buy located at 4610 South 76th Street, in the City of Greenfield, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin.

*Cooperate with agent.
*Mental Health assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*Take all prescribed medications.

*Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*Random urine screens with no positive results.

timeConds.notes:
*With Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and treatment.
*Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the Condition Time to be used at the discretion of the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A Hall

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.   

AS TO COUNT 1:  THE COURT ORDERED THE Defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction (HOC), consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 10 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and treatment. 

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS with the following conditions:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay the DNA fee out of bail on deposit, if any; with the balance due prior to the end of the probationary period. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept. Court waives all other costs and surcharges. Defendant indigent.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results.
*  No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
*  Mental Health assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Take all prescribed medications.
*  No contact with Best Buy located at 4610 South 76th Street, in the City of Greenfield, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.

CONDITION OF PROBATION:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to serve 60 DAYS Condition Time at the House of Correction (HOC) with Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and treatment.

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the Condition Time to be used at the discretion of the agent.

Received and filed with the court:
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant David A Hall in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2:  On motion of the State the Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED AND READ-IN.
